intro: Primula poetica, commonly known as the poet's primrose, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that come in shades of white, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features broad, heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections worldwide.
